# 1 Initiating packages

# 2 Introduction to the dataset
```{r Package Help, include=debug}

food_world_cup
```

```{r}
# Showing statistics
summary(food_world_cup)

```

# 3 Creating reports
```{r}
#ggplot(data=subset(gapminder, (year==2007) & (country=="Thailand" | country=="Singapore"| country=="Japan")
b2 <- ggplot(data=subset(food_world_cup, (algeria!="N/A")), aes(x=algeria, fill=gender)) +
        geom_bar() +
        labs(x="Country", y="Population", title="Population of Japan, Singapore, and Thailand in 2007")

b2
```

```{r}
b2 <- ggplot(data=subset(food_world_cup, (china!="N/A")), aes(x=china, fill=gender)) +
        geom_bar() +
        labs(x="China Score", y="Count by Gender", title="China Cuisine score by gender")

b2
```

```{r}
b2 <- ggplot(data=subset(subset(food_world_cup, (thailand!="N/A")),location!="NA"), aes(x=location, fill=thailand)) +
        geom_bar(position = "fill") +
        labs(x="thailand Score", y="Count by Gender", title="China Cuisine score by gender") +
    theme(axis.text.x = element_text(angle = 45, hjust = 1))

b2
```

```{r}
b2 <- ggplot(data=subset(subset(food_world_cup, (thailand!="N/A")),location!="NA"), aes(x=location, fill=thailand)) +
        geom_bar(position = "fill") +
        labs(x="thailand Score", y="Count by Gender", title="China Cuisine score by gender") +
    theme(axis.text.x = element_text(angle = 45, hjust = 1))

b2
```
